{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2015}} {{Use Indian English|date=November 2015}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:''Manathe Kottaram''}} {{Infobox film | name = Manathe Kottaram | image = Manathe Kottaram poster.jpg | alt = | caption = | director = Sunil | producer = Hameed | writer = Kalabhavan Ansar
[[Robin Thirumala]] | starring = {{unbulleted list|[[Dileep]]|[[Kushboo]]|[[Suresh Gopi]]|[[Jagathy Sreekumar]]|[[Harisree Ashokan]]|[[Indrans]]|[[Nadirsha]] }} | music = Berny Ignatious | cinematography = | editing = | studio = Gemi Movies | distributor = Star Plus Release | runtime = 122 minutes | released = 1994 | country = India | language = Malayalam | budget = | gross = | sound design = }} '''''Manathe Kottaram''''' ({{Translation|Palace on the sky}}) is a 1994 Indian [[Malayalam]]-language [[comedy-drama]] film directed by [[Sunil (director)|Sunil]] and written by Kalabhavan Ansar and Robin. The film was produced by Hameed under the banner of Gemi Movies and distributed by Star Plus Release. It stars [[Dileep (Malayalam actor)|Dileep]], Nadirsha, [[Indrans]], [[Harisree Ashokan]] and [[Kushboo]] in the lead roles. Suresh Gopi makes a cameo appearance. == Plot == Four struggling young men who were big fans of movie actress Khushboo finally get a chance to meet and befriend her when she moves into the mansion next door and through her Dileep also gets a chance to star in a movie. ==Cast== * [[Dileep (actor)|Dileep]] as Dileep * [[Nadirsha]] as Sabu * [[Harisree Ashokan]] as Balan * [[Indrans]] as Appu * [[Jagathy Sreekumar]] as Abraham John * [[Kushboo]] as Kushboo * [[Suresh Gopi]] as Satheesh Nair * [[Rajan P. Dev]] as Luckochan Pettah * [[Paravoor Bharathan]] as Swamy * [[Mala Aravindan]] as Kumaran * [[Usharani]] as Kanakam * [[N. L. Balakrishnan]] * [[C. I. Paul]] as Sebastain Pettah * [[Sadiq]] as Thomas Pettah/Thomachen * Tony as Xavier Pettah/Xavichen * [[Rizabawa]] as Cameo Appearance * [[Shankar (actor)|Shankar]] as Director Shankar (Cameo Appearance) * [[A. K. Lohithadas]] as Cameo Appearance * [[Siddique (director)|Siddique]] as Cameo Appearance * [[Lal (actor)|Lal]] as Cameo Appearance * [[Shaji Kailas]] as Cameo Appearance * [[Sibi Malayil]] as Cameo Appearance * [[Bobby Kottarakkara]] as Cinematographer * [[Kunchan (actor)]] as Security Guard * [[T. P. Madhavan]] as Security Guard * [[Philomina]] as Dileep's mother * [[Narayanankutty]] as Map seller == Soundtrack == The film's soundtrack contains 5 songs, all composed by [[Berny Ignatius]], with lyrics by [[Gireesh Puthenchery]]. {| border="10" cellpadding="10" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 95%;" |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" align="center" ! # !! Title !! Singer(s) |- | 1 | "Kanneerkkinaavinte Ullil" | [[M. G. Sreekumar]] |- | 2 | "Manjuruki Pinne Kaanam" | [[K. G. Markose]] |- | 3 | "Parapampam Pamparam Pole" | M. G. Sreekumar, K. G. Markose |- | 4 | "Poonilaamazha" | M. G. Sreekumar, [[K. S. Chitra]] |- | 5 | "Poonilaamazha" (F) | K. S.
